children.subject: Really wanted to work there but unfortunately got rejected last round :(
the two cal grads also made GIMP while a part of xcf : )

We pay competitive rates :) if you want real numbers, you’re free to check out resources like Glassdoor and h1binfo. 

Also, to be honest, if you’re optimizing for guaranteed income first and foremost, Cockroach Labs is not the best option for you, but if you optimize for passion, you should definitely consider us if the world of databases (or distributed systems) interests you.

history.content:
Hello everyone! I hope you've been enjoying the beginning of new semester so far! I have a proposition for people who are graduating this semester and looking for full-time opportunities: if you took CS186 and found working on databases as fascinating as I do (or you just love databases), I'd encourage you to consider Cockroach Labs (https://www.cockroachlabs.com/) for full-time positions! We make CockroachDB, an open-sourced ultra-resilient SQL database, and are based in NYC. The company was founded by three ex-Google engineers (two of which graduated from Cal :) ) in 2015 and have been making an incredible progress on the product. We're also actively hiring to expand our San Francisco office, so if you want to stay in the Bay Area, HQ in NYC should not be a concern. Many people work remotely (from a satellite office or from home), probably over 25% of all employees at the moment (myself included).

 

I interned at Cockroach during Summer 2018 and absolutely loved my experience - like I was looking forward to coming to the office on Monday. We have an awesome culture with super-flexible work schedule and great "life/work balance," as we call it. As an example, we have Flex Fridays - similar to 20% rule of Google - which gives every Friday for all employees to self-manage (anyone can choose what to work on Fridays, no questions asked, be it working on a side project or doing the work, reading up on research papers, or just taking a day off); I suggest to lookup the blog for some posts of what employees choose to do with their Fridays.

 

I started as a full-time engineer about a month ago, and I'm super happy about my decision of accepting the offer. Anyway, we're actively hiring, so if you're interested in applying or want to learn more about the company/product, please contact me at yuzefovich@berkeley.edu (or post questions as follow-ups to this post).

P.S. Please do check out our blog (https://www.cockroachlabs.com/blog) - it is awesome!
history.subject: [JOB HUNT] Interested in working on a new generation database?
